qas.question: What was the name of the aircraft that crashed into the World Trade Center's North Tower on September 11, 2001?
What was the name of the aircraft that crashed into the World Trade Center's South Tower on September 11, 2001?
How many firefighters died in the World Trade Center attack?
On what date did the World Trade Center PATH begin operation?
How tall is One World Trade Center in meters?
The Hudson Terminal which was also demolished was build in what year?
How many leader terrorists of Al Quada were involved with the 9/11 attacks directly that day?
What was the plane named that crashed into the World Trade Center?

context: The city and surrounding area suffered the bulk of the economic damage and largest loss of human life in the aftermath of the September 11, 2001 attacks when <a6_0>10<a6_0/> of the 19 terrorists associated with Al-Qaeda piloted <a0_0><a7_0>American Airlines Flight 11<a7_0/><a0_0/> into the North Tower of the World Trade Center and <a1_0>United Airlines Flight 175<a1_0/> into the South Tower of the World Trade Center, and later destroyed them, killing 2,192 civilians, <a2_0>343<a2_0/> firefighters, and 71 law enforcement officers who were in the towers and in the surrounding area. The rebuilding of the area, has created a new One World Trade Center, and a 9/11 memorial and museum along with other new buildings and infrastructure. The World Trade Center PATH station, which opened on <a3_0>July 19, <a5_0>1909<a5_0/><a3_0/> as the Hudson Terminal, was also destroyed in the attack. A temporary station was built and opened on November 23, 2003. A permanent station, the World Trade Center Transportation Hub, is currently under construction. The new One World Trade Center is the tallest skyscraper in the Western Hemisphere and the fourth-tallest building in the world by pinnacle height, with its spire reaching a symbolic 1,776 feet (<a4_0>541.3<a4_0/> m) in reference to the year of American independence.
